TEXT: The applicant , a NORP citizen born in DATE , is a businessman residing in GPE in GPE . Before the ORG he is represented by PERSON , a lawyer practising in PERSON in GPE .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

On DATE at approximately CARDINALhCARDINAL , the applicant was driving on a motorway in GPE in the direction of GPE . At CARDINAL stage , when driving on the left lane , he noted a neutral car behind him which kept coming up towards him and then falling back again . The applicant felt endangered ; as he could not move to the right lane , he decided to accelerate , though the car behind him did the same . Eventually , the applicant was able to move to the right lane and then leave the motorway at the next exit . Still the car followed him . It suddenly overtook him and the co - driver held a police - signal out of the window , ordering him to stop .

The applicant stopped and realised that the persons in the car were CARDINAL policemen . He was accompanied to a motorway stop where he was told that he had exceeded the speed limit of QUANTITY by an average of QUANTITY would be fined MONEY ( CHF ) . The applicant was shown a video film of his driving which the policemen had recorded from their car while following him . The applicant pointed out that he had been followed for a longer period of time ; originally he had driven at QUANTITY / h and had been pressed by the car to drive more quickly . The police replied that they had had to follow him for a certain stretch in order to obtain valid readings . The readings concerned a stretch of QUANTITY .
The applicant did not pay the fine and signed the police report .
On DATE ORG ( PERSON ) issued a penal order ( PERSON ) sentencing the applicant to DATE imprisonment , suspended on probation , and a fine of QUANTITY for having exceeded the speed limit by QUANTITY
Throughout the ensuing proceedings the applicant was represented by a lawyer .
Upon the applicant 's objection , ORG ) requested ORG ( Bezirksgericht ) to punish the applicant with DATE imprisonment and a fine of CARDINAL .

On DATE the ORG summoned the applicant and police officer PERSON ( the co - driver ) to the trial . The invitation was sent to the applicant 's previous address in GPE in GPE by means of letters rogatory ( PERSON ) , though the invitation could not be served as the applicant had meanwhile moved to GPE .

At the hearing on DATE the applicant was absent , and considered not to have provided an excuse herefor . At the hearing police officer PERSON was heard , explaining inter alia the video - system used , his experience in such matters , and that the applicant had driven at QUANTITY / h . The police officer submitted CARDINAL photos which were taken from the video film . The photos register inter alia the speed of the applicant ’s car . On CARDINAL photos there is a distance of QUANTITY between the applicant and the police car , often with ample free space on the right lane on the motorway ; and on the twelfth and last picture the police car had come closer to the applicant ’s car in order to film the applicant ’s number plate .

At the hearing , hand written TIME of police officer PERSON were submitted according to which the applicant had overtaken the police car at a speed of just below QUANTITY The minutes also noted : " he has allegedly been chased by the police " ( " er sei durch Pol . gejagt worden " ) . This statement was apparently not included in the subsequent typed TIME of the hearing .
The summons to the applicant for a new hearing on DATE could not be served on him either .

On DATE the ORG President issued a warrant of arrest against the applicant in order " to secure his presence at the trial " ( " Sicherung der Hauptverhandlung " ) . The applicant was arrested on DATE when entering GPE . He then withdrew his objection against the penal order of DATE . As a result , ORG struck the case off its list .
The applicant filed an appeal which was upheld by ORG ) of the GPE of GPE on DATE which found , inter alia , that the applicant had not been absent at the hearing of DATE by his own fault .

Proceedings were resumed before ORG which fixed a new trial for DATE . As the applicant only received the invitation on DATE , a new hearing was fixed for DATE . The applicant challenged the President of ORG , whereupon the Deputy President presided .
At the hearing , the applicant unsuccessfully requested to question the second police officer ( the driver ) and to be shown the entire video film .

On DATE ORG sentenced the applicant to DATE imprisonment , suspended on probation , and a fine of QUANTITY . In its decision the ORG found that the video film clearly demonstrated the excess in speed , and there was no indication that the registration system was faulty . In view thereof and of PERSON 's statement of DATE , the ORG refused to hear the other police officer . The ORG also found that the applicant , who alleged that he had been pressed by the police , had been able to comment on PERSON 's statements .
On DATE the applicant challenged the Deputy ORG President in view of the manner in which he had conducted the proceedings .
On DATE the applicant filed an appeal in which he requested , inter alia , to be shown the entire video film leading to his conviction , and to be able to put questions to both police officers .

The appeal was dismissed by ORG of the GPE of GPE on DATE . The ORG , which had the competence to decide on both the factual and legal issues of the case , relied in its decision , inter alia , on statements of police officer PERSON as to the events . The ORG found that CARDINAL particular statement of PERSON was an incorrect assessment , namely that a police car regularly drove QUANTITY behind a car when the speed exceeded QUANTITY / h ; in fact the pictures demonstrated that the police had driven QUANTITY behind the applicant .

In respect of the applicant 's requests for the taking of evidence , ORG found that the applicant had been shown CARDINAL pictures of the video film which sufficed to demonstrate that he had exceeded the speed limit , and that he had not been pressed by the police . The gaps of TIME between the pictures were too short to prove otherwise . For the same reason the police officers need not be heard , and their statements would not alter the ORG 's opinion . Indeed , even if the police had pressed the applicant , this would not justify the excess in speed . In any event , police officer PERSON had been heard , and his statement had been shown to the applicant .

The applicant ’s public law appeal ( staatsrechtliche Beschwerde ) and plea of nullity ( PERSON ) were dismissed by ORG on DATE , the decision being served on DATE . In its decision the ORG found that the applicant had not shown that ORG had acted arbitrarily . Thus , even if it was accepted that the police car had pressed him by coming up towards him and falling back again this would not help him , as he would then have had periods where he would have reduced his speed . In respect of the applicant 's complaint about the alleged bias of ORG , ORG found that the decision of ORG would have healed any such shortcoming .

Under the headline " disciplinary punishment " , ORG stated that the applicant 's appeals clearly lacked prospects of success in view of the convincing reasons given by ORG of the GPE of LOC in its decision . The decision continues :

" The long - winded statements in his plea of nullity and in large parts also in his public law appeal are not reasonable . The applicant 's representative shall therefore be admonished in accordance with DATE ( CARDINAL ) of LAW . "
